original: Bergendal, Tomas Arvid Tomasson, assuransdirektör, kapten, Göteborg, f. 22n/%S i Söderfors, Upps. 1., av bruksdisp. Tom E. G. B. o. Maria Strömbom. G. 13 m. Sigrun Edling. — Stud:ex. i Upps. 04, stud. v. tekn. högsk. o. v. hand:sk. Und:löjtn. i Svea art:reg. res. 08, löjtn. 14, kapt. 23. Ing. v. Sv. Diamantbergborrn. A-B, kont :chef v. Sv-Ryska StåHinefabr :a i Sthlm 15, rev:- o. insp :uppdr. av försäkr :insp. 21-26, verkst. dir. i Sjö-försäkr. A-B Gauthiod i Gbg sed. 26. RVO.
translated: Bergendal, Tomas Arvid Tomasson, insurance director, captain, Gothenburg, born on 22nd of %S in Söderfors, Uppsala County, son of Tom E. G. B. and Maria Strömbom who worked as an industrial superintendent. Married to Sigrun Edling in 1913. He graduated from Uppsala Secondary School in 1904 and studied at the Technical University and the School of Commerce. He served as a second lieutenant in the Svea Artillery Regiment Reserve in 1908, became lieutenant in 1914 and captain in 1923. He worked as an engineer for the Swedish Diamond Drilling Co. Ltd, was the head of the Stockholm Russo-Swedish Steel Factory from 1915, and had reviewing and inspection duties for the insurance inspectorate from 1921 to 1926. He was the managing director of the Marine Insurance Company Gauthiod AB in Gothenburg from 1926. He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa.
